1.Flush mouse tibiae and femurs with ice-cold PBS through a 70 μm-wide cut-off cell strainer.
Resuspend pelleted cells in conditioned medium \(supplemented with 10% of growth supernatant of GM-CSF-transduced B16 cells).
3.Seed 7 x 10<sup>6</sup> cells in 100 x 20 mm non-treated cell culture plates in 10 ml of conditioned medium.
5.On day 4 and 7 add 5 ml of pre-warmed conditioned medium.
6.At day 8/9 the percentage of CD11c+ cells should be higher than 90% as measured by FACS analysis.
BMDCs are then ready for experimental use.
7.Harvest the supernatant and gently wash the plate once with 5 ml of pre-warmed PBS.
8.Incubate 2’ with 5 ml of 2mM EDTA at 37 °C – 5% CO<sub>2</sub>.
10.Centrifuge 5’ at 1200 rpm and resuspend pelleted cells in conditioned medium.
